snippet: Randi Weingarten, the president of the American Federation of Teachers, said educators needed a year to master a new curriculum before schools should be held accountable for results.
abstract: Randi Weingarten, president of the American Federation of Teachers, calls for school systems to postpone using new set of academic standards to evaluate teachers and promote students; says educators need a year to master new curriculum before schools should be held accountable for results; Weingarten's message appears largely aimed at New York State.
lead_paragraph: Randi Weingarten, the president of the American Federation of Teachers, said educators needed a year to master a new curriculum before schools should be held accountable for results.

headline.seo: Postpone Use of New Test Scores, Teachers’ Union Leader Says
headline.main: Union Chief Recommends Delay in Use of Test Scores
headline.print_headline: Union Chief Recommends Delay in Use Of Test Scores
